result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael M Fant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence, with credit for 9 days time served
Extended Supervision and Probation conditions same

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges during the course of probation to the probation agent, cash bail to apply. Any remaiing balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.

No firearms/weapons.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession; and Voting

No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with Arthur G. Jr. (3-9-91), or Earl J. (10-30-71).

Maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
Attend at least 1 sobriety support group per week.
Provide DNA sample (unless previously submitted) and pay surcharge.
Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class.
AODA assessment and comply with any treatment

timeConds.notes:
Release for the Day Reporting Center ONLY, with good time credit, with credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt: Stop payemnt has been done, see financial information for more details.

Order, signed and filed. 
The defendant's request for release on electronic monitoring is denied as it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent. 
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for release on electronic monitoring.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated August 4, 2014, received and filed.

06-20-14

Defendant already has $500.00 on deposit, must post an additional $500.00 for release.   Upon release, defendant to continue with Justice Point monitoring.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.
Justice Point violation addressed; defendant is not in compliance.  Court granted state's motion for modification of bail.

Defendant Michael M Fant in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).  All parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be assigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17 in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Violation Report received and filed with court. Defendant scheduled for Sentencing on 06-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael M Fant in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Case rescheduled for adjourned sentencing or motion for recusal.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Received after court date.

Defendant Michael M Fant in court with attorney Scott F Anderson.  Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 26.   COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Defendant shall not vote until civil rights are restored.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.

css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Michael M Fant in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Michael M Fant in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
